/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountDelete]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountDelete]
(
	@PKAccountID int
)
AS
BEGIN
	Declare @FKLevelID int
	
	Select @FKLevelID = FKLevelID from Account where PKAccountID = @PKAccountID
	
	if(@FKLevelID = 1)
	begin
	    if exists(select null from Account where Email = 'adamfodonnell@gmail.com' and PKAccountID = @PKAccountID)
			select -2 as Result -- can not delete Admin
		else
		begin
		DELETE FROM Account where PKAccountID = @PKAccountID
		select 1 as Result
		end
	End	
	else
	BEGIN

		Declare @StateMent nvarchar(max) 
         select @StateMent = '';
         with shows as
         (select s.FKShowID as ShowID from ShowManagers s where s.FKAccountID = @PKAccountID and 1 = (select count(sm.FKShowID) from ShowManagers sm group by sm.FKShowID having sm.FKShowID =  s.FKShowID))
			select @StateMent = @StateMent + 'EXEC ShowDelete ' + cast(ShowID as varchar) +';' from shows
			EXEC sp_executesql @StateMent


		delete from ShowManagers where FKAccountID = @PKAccountID
		DELETE FROM Account where PKAccountID = @PKAccountID
		SELECT 1 as Result
		--if not exists(select PKShowManagerID from ShowManagers where FKAccountID = @PKAccountID)
		--BEGIN
		--	DELETE FROM Account where PKAccountID = @PKAccountID	
		--	SELECT 1 as Result
		--END
		--ELSE
		--BEGIN
		--	Select -1 as Result -- Already used in the system
		--END
	END
END

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountInsert]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountInsert] (  
 @FirstName varchar(50),  
 @LastName varchar(50),  
 @UserName varchar(50),  
 @Password varchar(50),  
 @Email varchar(50),  
 @Position varchar(50),  
 @ProfileImagePath varchar(100),  
 @IsActive bit,  
 --@Level nvarchar(1000)  
 @FKLevelID int,  
 @NearestAirport varchar(150)  
   
)  
AS  
begin  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
if exists (Select null from Account where [UserName] = @UserName)  
begin  
select -1  
end  
else if exists (Select null from Account where [Email] = @Email)  
begin  
select -2  
end  
else  
begin  
  
INSERT INTO Account (  
 [FirstName],  
 [LastName],  
 [UserName],  
 [Password],  
 [Email],  
 [Position],  
 [ProfileImagePath],  
 [IsActive],  
 [FKLevelID],  
 [NearestAirport]  
) VALUES (  
 @FirstName,  
 @LastName,  
 @UserName,  
 @Password,  
 @Email,  
 @Position,  
 @ProfileImagePath,  
 @IsActive,  
 @FKLevelID,  
 @NearestAirport  
)  
  
end  
end


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountSelect]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountSelect] (    
 @PKAccountID int    
)    
AS    
    
SET NOCOUNT ON    
    
SELECT    
 a.[PKAccountID],    
 a.[FirstName],    
 a.[LastName],    
 a.[UserName],    
 a.[Password],    
 a.[Email],    
 a.[Position],    
 a.[ProfileImagePath],    
 a.[IsActive],    
 a.FKLevelID,    
 l.[Description] as [Level],    
 l.[LevelName] as [LevelName],    
 a.ResetID,    
 a.[NearestAirport]    
FROM    
 Account a left join dbo.[Level] l on a.FKLevelID = l.PKLevelID    
WHERE    
 a.[PKAccountID] = @PKAccountID    
     
     
--select FKLevelID from AccountLevel where FKAccountID = @PKAccountID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountSelectAll]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
--exec [tblAccountSelectAll]  1,5,'FirstName','Desc',''    
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountSelectAll](    
 @PageIndex INT,    
 @RecordsPerPage INT,    
 @SortBy nvarchar(50),    
 @OrderBy nvarchar(50),    
 @SearchText nvarchar(50)    
 )    
  AS    
SET NOCOUNT ON    
 Declare @startRowIndex INT;    
 Declare @endRowIndex INT;    
 declare @Str nvarchar(max)    
 set @endRowIndex = (@PageIndex * @RecordsPerPage);    
 set @startRowIndex = (@endRowIndex - @RecordsPerPage) + 1;    
     
set @Str = 'select * from (    
 SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY '+@SortBy+' '+@OrderBy+') as Row,    
    [PKAccountID],    
 [FirstName],    
 [LastName],    
 [UserName],    
 [Password],    
 [NearestAirport],    
 [Email],    
 [Position],    
 [ProfileImagePath],    
 [IsActive],    
 FKLevelID,    
 ResetID,    
 (select [Description] from dbo.[Level] where PKLevelID = FKLevelID) as [Level]     
      FROM [dbo].[Account] where    
      FirstName like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%'' or     
      UserName like''%''  + @SearchText+''%''  or     
      [LastName]like ''%''  + @SearchText+''%''      
 )    
 as tmpTable    
 WHERE Row between     
 @startRowIndex and @endRowIndex;'    
      
 print(@STR)    
     
     
 -- Table 1: Content record    
 EXEC sp_executesql @STR, N' @endRowIndex INT = NULL,    
        @startRowIndex INT = NULL,    
        @SortBy nvarchar(50)=null,    
        @OrderBy nvarchar(50)=null,    
        @SearchText nvarchar(50)=null',    
        @endRowIndex,    
        @startRowIndex,    
        @SortBy,    
        @OrderBy,    
        @SearchText;    
     
 SELECT COUNT(*) FROM [dbo].[Account] where    
      FirstName like '%' + @SearchText+'%' or     
      UserName like '%' + @SearchText+'%' or     
      [LastName]like '%' + @SearchText+'%'


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountSelectByEmailAddess]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountSelectByEmailAddess] (  
 @Email varchar(100)  
)  
AS  
  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
SELECT  
 a.[PKAccountID],  
 a.[FirstName],  
 a.[LastName],  
 a.[UserName],  
 a.[Password],  
 a.[Email],  
 a.[Position],  
 a.[ProfileImagePath],  
 a.[IsActive],  
 a.NearestAirport,  
 a.FKLevelID,  
 l.[Description] as [Level],  
 l.[LevelName] as [LevelName]  
   
FROM  
 Account a left join dbo.[Level] l on a.FKLevelID = l.PKLevelID  
WHERE  
 a.[Email] = @Email   
   
   
--select FKLevelID from AccountLevel where FKAccountID = @PKAccountID


GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountSelectByResetID] (  
 @ResetID varchar(100)  
)  
AS  
  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
SELECT  
 a.[PKAccountID],  
 a.[FirstName],  
 a.[LastName],  
 a.[UserName],  
 a.[Password],  
 a.[Email],  
 a.[Position],  
 a.[ProfileImagePath],  
 a.NearestAirport,  
 a.[IsActive],  
 a.FKLevelID,  
 l.[Description] as [Level],  
 l.[LevelName] as [LevelName]  
   
FROM  
 Account a left join dbo.[Level] l on a.FKLevelID = l.PKLevelID  
WHERE  
 a.[ResetID] = @ResetID   
   
   
--select FKLevelID from AccountLevel where FKAccountID = @PKAccountID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountSelectForselection]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE procedure [dbo].[AccountSelectForselection]
as
Select FirstName + dbo.RemoveLastDashChars(LastName) as Name,PKAccountID from Account

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AccountUpdate]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AccountUpdate] (    
 @PKAccountID int,    
 @FirstName varchar(50),    
 @LastName varchar(50),    
 @UserName varchar(50),    
 @Password varchar(50),    
 @Email varchar(50),    
 @Position varchar(50),    
 @ProfileImagePath varchar(100),    
 @IsActive bit,    
 --@Level nvarchar(1000)    
 @FKLevelID int,    
 @ResetID uniqueidentifier,    
 @NearestAirport varchar(150)    
)    
AS    
begin    
SET NOCOUNT ON    
if exists (Select null from Account where [UserName] = @UserName and [PKAccountID] <> @PKAccountID)    
begin    
select -1    
end    
else if exists (Select null from Account where [Email] = @Email and [PKAccountID] <> @PKAccountID)    
begin    
select -2    
end    
else    
begin    
    
UPDATE    
 Account    
SET    
 [FirstName] = @FirstName,    
 [LastName] = @LastName,    
 [UserName] = @UserName,    
 [Password] = @Password,    
 [Email] = @Email,    
 --[Position] = @Position,    
 [ProfileImagePath] = @ProfileImagePath,    
 [IsActive] = @IsActive,    
 FKLevelID = @FKLevelID,    
 ResetID = @ResetID,    
 [NearestAirport] = @NearestAirport    
WHERE    
  [PKAccountID] = @PKAccountID    
      
      
select @PKAccountID    
    
end    
end


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AddEditShowBindings]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AddEditShowBindings]
AS
BEGIN
	SELECT PKPositionID,
	       PositionName
	FROM   [Position]
	
	SELECT CustomerName,
	       PKCustomerID
	FROM   Customer
	
	SELECT CASE WHEN LEN(FirstName) > 20 THEN  SUBSTRING(FirstName, 0, 20) ELSE FirstName end AS FirstName,
	       PKAccountID
	FROM   Account
	WHERE  FKLevelID = 3
END


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AdminDashBoard]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
--- Exec [AdminDashBoard] 10  
 -- SELECT SUM(t.Rating), avg(rating) FROM Technician t
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AdminDashBoard]   
  
(  
  
 @UserID int   
  
)  
  
AS  
  
 SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
 DECLARE @CurrentDate DATETIME  
  
 SET @CurrentDate = GETDATE()    
  
 DECLARE @PreviousSDate DATETIME,@PreviousEDate DATETIME  
  
 SET @PreviousSDate = DATEADD(dd, -(DATEPART(dw, @CurrentDate-1)), @CurrentDate +1)  
 SET @PreviousEDate = DATEADD(dd, 7-(DATEPART(dw, @CurrentDate-1)), @CurrentDate )  
  
 DECLARE @NextSDate DATETIME,@NextEDate DATETIME  
  
 SET @NextSDate =  DATEADD(dd, 7-(DATEPART(dw, @CurrentDate-1)), @CurrentDate +1)  
 SET @NextEDate = DATEADD(dd, 14-(DATEPART(dw, @CurrentDate-1)), @CurrentDate )  
  
   
  
   
  
 SELECT TOP 4 PKShowID,  
  
        Title,  
  
        Title + ' "'+ SUBSTRING(CAST((DATEPART(yy, StartDate)) AS VARCHAR), 3, 2) AS ShowTitleWithYear  
  
 FROM   [Show]  
  
 WHERE  StartDate BETWEEN cast(cast(@PreviousSDate as varchar(12)) as datetime) AND @PreviousEDate  
  
   
  
 SELECT TOP 4 PKShowID,  
  
        Title,  
  
        Title +' "'+ SUBSTRING(CAST((DATEPART(yy, StartDate)) AS VARCHAR), 3, 2) AS ShowTitleWithYear  
  
 FROM   [Show]  
  
 WHERE  StartDate BETWEEN cast(cast(@NextSDate as varchar(12)) as datetime) AND @NextEDate  
  
   
  
   
  
   
  
 -- For Basic Information  
  
DECLARE @AvgDayRate DECIMAL(10,2),@PastDayAvgDayRate DECIMAL(10,2),@PastDayAvgRating DECIMAL(10,2)

set @AvgDayRate = (select CAST(isnull(AVG(BidAmount),0) as decimal(10,2)) from Bid WHERE Bid.FKTechnicianID IN (SELECT t.PKTechnicianID FROM Technician t WHERE t.isApproved = 1))

SET @PastDayAvgDayRate = (select CAST(isnull(AVG(BidAmount),0) as decimal(10,2)) from Bid WHERE  CONVERT(VARCHAR, bid.CreatedDate, 101) < CONVERT(VARCHAR, GETDATE(), 101) AND  Bid.FKTechnicianID IN 
 (SELECT t.PKTechnicianID FROM Technician t WHERE t.isApproved = 1))
 
SET @PastDayAvgRating = (SELECT cast(AVG(isnull(r.TRating,0)) AS DECIMAL(3,2)) FROM Technician t LEFT JOIN (SELECT AVG(isnull(Ratings.AverateRate,0)) AS TRating,Ratings.FKTechnicianID
  FROM Ratings GROUP BY Ratings.FKTechnicianID,Ratings.FeedbackDate HAVING CONVERT(VARCHAR, FeedbackDate, 101) < CONVERT(VARCHAR, GETDATE(), 101)) 
  AS r ON t.PKTechnicianID = r.FKTechnicianID WHERE t.isApproved = 1)
  
  
select 1,  
  
 (select FKLevelID from Account where PKAccountID = @UserID) as LevelID,  
  
 (select Count(PKAccountID) from Account where FKLevelID=1) as AdminCount,  
  
 cast(avg(ISNULL(Rating,0)) as decimal(10,2)) as AvgRating,
 @AvgDayRate as AvgDayRate,   
 @PastDayAvgDayRate as PastDayAvgDayRate, 
 @PastDayAvgRating AS PastDayAvgRating,
 COUNT(PKTechnicianID) as TotalTech,   
  CASE 
       WHEN (@AvgDayRate >= @PastDayAvgDayRate) THEN 1
       ELSE 0
  END AS RateAStatus,
  CASE 
       WHEN ((cast(avg(ISNULL(Rating,0)) as decimal(10,2))) >= @PastDayAvgRating) THEN 1
       ELSE 0
  END AS RatingAStatus,
 (select AVG(BidCount) from (  
  
 select COUNT(PKBidID) as BidCount from Bid group by FKShowID) as AvgBids) as AvgBids  
    
 from  Technician  WHERE isApproved = 1  
 
 
 -- Company Overview
 
 select 1,
 (Select ISNULL(AVG(cr.AverageRate),0) from Show s    
  inner join CustomerShowRating cr on cr.FKShowID = s.PKShowID 
  where StartDate <= GETDATE()) as NetAvg, 
 (select COUNT(PKShowID) from Show where StartDate <= GETDATE()) As ShowCount

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AdminMessageDelete]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AdminMessageDelete] (
	@SenderID int,
	@MessageID int
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON
delete from SentMessage where FKMessageID = @MessageID
Delete from Message where PKMessageID = @MessageID

--update [SentMessage] set [IsDeleted] = 1 where [RecieverID] = @SenderID and [FKMessageID] = @MessageID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AdminMessageListingDetails]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO


--- Exec TechnicianMessageListing 122

CREATE Procedure [dbo].[AdminMessageListingDetails]

(

	@AdminID int 

)

as



begin

--Select *, (select FirstName from Account where FKLevelID = LevelID and PKAccountID = SenderID) as SenderName 

--from Message where PkMessageID in (Select FKMessageID from SentMessage where RecieverID = @TechnicianID) order by MessageDate Desc

SELECT m.PKMessageID, m.MessageDate, m.Description, m.SenderID, m.LevelID, m.IsReply, m.ParentID, sm.IsRead, sm.RecieverID, sm.IsDeleted,(select FirstName from Technician where FKLevelID = LevelID and PkTechnicianID = m.SenderID) as SenderName 

FROM  Message AS m INNER JOIN SentMessage AS sm ON m.PKMessageID = sm.FKMessageID where sm.IsDeleted = 0 and sm.RecieverID = @AdminID order by m.MessageDate Desc

update SentMessage set IsRead = 1 where IsDeleted = 0 and RecieverID = @AdminID

end

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AdminSentMessageListing]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

--- Exec [AdminSentMessageListing] 10

CREATE Procedure [dbo].[AdminSentMessageListing]

(

	@AdminID int 

)

as



begin

--Select *, (select FirstName from Account where FKLevelID = LevelID and PKAccountID = SenderID) as SenderName 

--from Message where PkMessageID in (Select FKMessageID from SentMessage where RecieverID = @TechnicianID) order by MessageDate Desc

SELECT m.PKMessageID, m.MessageDate, m.Description, m.SenderID, m.LevelID, m.IsReply, m.ParentID,(select FirstName from Account where FKLevelID = LevelID and PKAccountID = m.SenderID) as SenderName

FROM  Message AS m where m.SenderID = @AdminID and m.LevelID = 1 order by m.MessageDate Desc



end

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[AllTechnicianByShow]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
-- =============================================
-- Author:		Name
-- Create date: 
-- Description:	
-- =============================================
-- EXEC AllTechnicianByShow 53
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[AllTechnicianByShow] 
	-- Add the parameters for the stored procedure here
	@ShowID int 
	 
AS
BEGIN
	-- SET NOCOUNT ON added to prevent extra result sets from
	-- interfering with SELECT statements.
	SET NOCOUNT ON;

    -- Insert statements for procedure here
	SELECT (Firstname +'  ' +LastName) as Name,tec.PKTechnicianID 
	FROM [dbo].[Technician] tec inner join Bid on tec.PKTechnicianID=Bid.FKTechnicianID  
    where Bid.isApproved  = 1 and tec.isApproved = 1  and Bid.FKShowID=@ShowID 

END


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[ApplicationErrorsInsert]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[ApplicationErrorsInsert] (
	@FileName varchar(100),
	@URL varchar(100),
	@Detail varchar(MAX),
	@LineNumber int,
	@ColumnNumber int,
	@UserID int,
	@IPAddress varchar(30),
	@IsSolved bit
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

INSERT INTO [ApplicationErrors] (
	[FileName],
	[URL],
	[Detail],
	[LineNumber],
	[ColumnNumber],
	[UserID],
	[IPAddress],
	[IsSolved]
) VALUES (
	@FileName,
	@URL,
	@Detail,
	@LineNumber,
	@ColumnNumber,
	@UserID,
	@IPAddress,
	@IsSolved
)

SELECT SCOPE_IDENTITY() AS PKErrorID


GO

Create PROCEDURE [dbo].[BidDeleteByShow] (@PKShowID INT)

		BEGIN
			
			Delete from bid where FKShowID = @PKShowID
		END
	




GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[BidInformationByShow]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
/************************************************************
 * Code formatted by SoftTree SQL Assistant © v4.5.9
 * Time: 12/12/2012 6:03:45 PM
 ************************************************************/
-- exec BidInformationByShow 24,''
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[BidInformationByShow](@ShowID INT, @SearchText NVARCHAR(50))
AS
BEGIN
	select * from (SELECT sp.FKPositionID,
	       (
	           SELECT PositionName
	           FROM   Position p
	           WHERE  p.PKPositionID = sp.FKPositionID
	       ) AS PositionName,
	       sp.NoOfPosition AS Needs,
	       (
	           SELECT COUNT(b.PKBidID)
	           FROM   Bid b
	           WHERE  b.FKShowID = @ShowID
	                  AND b.FKShowPositionID = sp.FKPositionID
	       ) AS Bids,
	       @ShowID as ShowID	       
	FROM   ShowPositions sp
	WHERE  sp.FKShowID = @ShowID) AS tmpTable where PositionName LIKE '%'+ @SearchText+'%'
	
	SELECT TOP 1 Title +' - ' as ShowTitle FROM Show s WHERE s.PKShowID = @ShowID
END

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[BidListingSelectAll]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
/************************************************************
 * Code formatted by SoftTree SQL Assistant © v4.5.9
 * Time: 12/12/2012 4:38:57 PM
 ************************************************************/
----Important Query for delete duplicate bids
 --DELETE FROM Bid WHERE PKBidId IN ( SELECT b.PKBidID
 --         FROM Bid b INNER JOIN Show s ON b.FKShowID = s.PKShowID WHERE 
 --       b.FKShowPositionID NOT IN (SELECT sp.FKPositionID FROM ShowPositions sp WHERE sp.FKShowID = s.PKShowID))
        
        
-- select * from Show
--exec [BidListingSelectAll]  1,30,'BidEndDate','Desc','',0
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[BidListingSelectAll](
    @PageIndex       INT,
    @RecordsPerPage  INT,
    @SortBy          NVARCHAR(50),
    @OrderBy         NVARCHAR(50),
    @SearchText      NVARCHAR(50),
    @CustomerID		 int
)
AS
	SET NOCOUNT ON
	BEGIN
		DECLARE @startRowIndex  INT;
		DECLARE @endRowIndex    INT;
		DECLARE @Str            NVARCHAR(MAX)
		SET @endRowIndex = (@PageIndex * @RecordsPerPage);
		SET @startRowIndex = (@endRowIndex - @RecordsPerPage) + 1;
		DECLARE @Today DATETIME
		SET @Today = cast(cast(GETDATE() as varchar(12)) as datetime) 
		
		
		SET @Str = ' select * from (select ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY '+@SortBy+' '+@OrderBy+') as Row,tmpTable.* from(   
			    SELECT      		
		       s.[PKShowID],
		       s.[Title],
		       s.[BidEndDate],
		       s.[FKCustomerID],
		       (
		           SELECT c.CustomerName
		           FROM   Customer c
		           WHERE  c.PKCustomerID = s.FKCustomerID
		       ) AS CustomerName,
		       ISNULL(
		           (
		               SELECT COUNT(bs.PKBidID)
		               FROM   bid bs
		               WHERE  bs.FKShowID = s.PKShowID
		               GROUP BY
		                      bs.FKShowID
		           ),
		           0
		       ) AS BidsRecieved,		 
		       CASE 
		            WHEN ((s.BidEndDate > @Today) or (s.BidEndDate = @Today)) THEN CAST(DATEDIFF(d, @Today, s.[BidEndDate]) AS VARCHAR) 
		                 + '' Days Remaining''
		            ELSE ''Completed''
		       END AS Status
		      
		FROM [dbo].[Show] s		       
		WHERE  ((s.bidStartDate < @Today) or (s.bidStartDate = @Today )) and s.[Title] like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%'' and (s.FKCustomerID = @CustomerID or @CustomerID= 0)) as tmpTable ) as tmp  
		WHERE Row between 
		@startRowIndex and @endRowIndex;'
		
		print(@STR)
	
	
	-- Table 1: Content record
	EXEC sp_executesql @STR, N'	@endRowIndex INT = NULL,
								@startRowIndex INT = NULL,
								@SortBy nvarchar(50)=null,
								@OrderBy nvarchar(50)=null,
								@SearchText nvarchar(50)=null,
								@Today datetime,
								@CustomerID int',
								@endRowIndex,
								@startRowIndex,
								@SortBy,
								@OrderBy,
								@SearchText,
								@Today,
								@CustomerID;
	
	SELECT COUNT(*) FROM [dbo].[Show] s WHERE  ((s.bidStartDate < @Today) or (s.bidStartDate = @Today )) and s.[Title] like '%' + @SearchText+'%' and (s.FKCustomerID = @CustomerID or @CustomerID= 0)
	END

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[BidPositionDetailsByShow]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
-- exec [BidPositionDetailsByShow] 24,0  

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[BidPositionDetailsByShow](@ShowID INT, @PositionID INT)  

AS  

BEGIN  

   

 IF(@PositionID = 0)  

 BEGIN  

  SET @PositionID = (SELECT TOP 1 sp.FKPositionID FROM ShowPositions sp WHERE  sp.FKShowID = @ShowID)  

 END  

 SELECT t.[PKTechnicianID],  

        t.[Firstname] AS TechnicianName,  

		t.Email,

        b.CreatedDate,  

		isnull(b.IsNotified,0) as IsNotified,

		b.PKBidID,

        ISNULL(  

            (  

                SELECT AVG(b.BidAmount)  

                FROM   bid b  

                WHERE  b.fktechnicianID = t.PKTechnicianID  

            ),  

            0  

        ) AS AvgBid,  

        ISNULL(b.BidAmount, 0) AS BidRate,  

   (select Title from Show where PKShowID = @ShowID) as ShowName,

   (SELECT RANK FROM (select row_number() over (order by isnull(t.Rating,0) desc, t.CreatedDate) as RANK,t.PKTechnicianID  

   FROM Technician t WHERE t.isApproved = 1 ) AS tmp WHERE tmp.PKTechnicianID = t.PKTechnicianID) AS Rank,  

        t.[Rating],  

        (  

            SELECT STUFF(  

                       (  

                           SELECT DISTINCT ', ' + (  

                                      SELECT p.PositionName   

                                      FROM   Position p  

                                      WHERE  p.pkPositionID = b.FKShowPositionID  

                                  )   

                                  FOR XML PATH('')  

                       ),  

                       1,  

                       1,  

                       ''  

                   )  

        ) AS Positions,  

        (SELECT TOP 1 p.PositionName FROM   Position p WHERE  p.pkPositionID = b.FKShowPositionID) AS Position, 
		  (SELECT TOP 1 p.pkPositionID FROM   Position p WHERE  p.pkPositionID = b.FKShowPositionID) AS pkPositionid,
		   
        ISNULL(b.isApproved, 0) AS Confirm,  

        b.FKShowPositionID,  

        ISNULL(b.IsSuggested,0) AS Suggest,  

        9.1 AS Value, --- to change  

        IsNULL((select top 1 TravelRate from TravelCost),0) AS Travel --- to change  

 FROM   dbo.Technician t  

        INNER JOIN Bid b  

             ON  t.PKTechnicianID = b.FKTechnicianID  

 WHERE  b.FKShowID = @ShowID AND b.FKShowPositionID = @PositionID  

   

   

 SELECT sp.FKPositionID,  

        (  

            SELECT PositionName  

            FROM   Position p  

            WHERE  p.PKPositionID = sp.FKPositionID  

        ) AS PositionName  

 FROM   ShowPositions sp  

 WHERE  sp.FKShowID = @ShowID  

   

 SELECT (  

            SELECT TOP 1 s.Title  

            FROM   Show s  

            WHERE  s.PKShowID = @ShowID  

        ) + ' - ' + (  

            SELECT TOP 1 PositionName  

            FROM   Position  

            WHERE  PKPositionID = @PositionID  

        ) +' ' AS ShowPosition  

          

          

       

END  





GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[BidSelect]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
---- Exec [BidSelect] 108
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[BidSelect] (
	@PKBidID int
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

SELECT
	[PKBidID],
	[FKShowID],
	[FKTechnicianID],
	[FKShowPositionID],
	[BidAmount],
	(technician.Firstname+' '+Technician.LastName) as TechnicianName,
	Show.Title as ShowName,
	Position.PositionName as PositionName,
	--[Comments],
	--[isApproved],
	--[ApprovedBy],
	--[ApprovedDate],
	--[isCancelled],
	--[CancelledBy],
	--[CancelledDate],
	--[ReasonforCancel],
	--[IsSuggested],
	--[SuggestedBy],
	--[CreatedDate],
	--[IsNotified],
	--[ToNotify],
	Technician.[Email]
	--[IsNotifiedAdmin]
FROM
	[Bid] inner join Technician on Bid.FKTechnicianID=Technician.PKTechnicianID inner join Show on Bid.FKShowID=Show.PKShowID  inner join Position on Bid.FKShowPositionID=Position.PKPositionID
WHERE
	[PKBidID] = @PKBidID

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[BidUpdate]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[BidUpdate] (
	@PKBidID int,
	@FKShowID int,
	@FKTechnicianID int,
	@FKShowPositionID int,
	@BidAmount float(53)
	--@Comments varchar(500),
	--@isApproved bit,
	--@ApprovedBy int,
	--@ApprovedDate datetime,
	--@isCancelled bit,
	--@CancelledBy int,
	--@CancelledDate datetime,
	--@ReasonforCancel varchar(500),
	--@IsSuggested bit,
	--@SuggestedBy int,
	--@CreatedDate datetime,
	--@IsNotified bit,
	--@ToNotify bit,
	--@Email nvarchar(255),
	--@IsNotifiedAdmin bit
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

UPDATE
	[Bid]
SET
	[FKShowID] = @FKShowID,
	[FKTechnicianID] = @FKTechnicianID,
	[FKShowPositionID] = @FKShowPositionID,
	[BidAmount] = @BidAmount
	--[Comments] = @Comments,
	--[isApproved] = @isApproved,
	--[ApprovedBy] = @ApprovedBy,
	--[ApprovedDate] = @ApprovedDate,
	--[isCancelled] = @isCancelled,
	--[CancelledBy] = @CancelledBy,
	--[CancelledDate] = @CancelledDate,
	--[ReasonforCancel] = @ReasonforCancel,
	--[IsSuggested] = @IsSuggested,
	--[SuggestedBy] = @SuggestedBy,
	--[CreatedDate] = @CreatedDate,
	--[IsNotified] = @IsNotified,
	--[ToNotify] = @ToNotify,
	--[Email] = @Email,
	--[IsNotifiedAdmin] = @IsNotifiedAdmin
WHERE
	 [PKBidID] = @PKBidID

GO

END

/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CheckAirportAndCity]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE procedure [dbo].[CheckAirportAndCity]
(
	@AirportName nvarchar(255),
	@City nvarchar(50),
	@AirportCode nvarchar(50)
)
as
begin
if exists(select null from Airports where AirportName = @AirportName and CityAreaServed = @City and AirportCode = @AirportCode)
begin
select 1
end
else
begin
select 0
end
end
GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CheckShowTitle]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CheckShowTitle] (@ShowID INT, @Title NVARCHAR(50))
AS
BEGIN
	SET NOCOUNT ON
	IF (@ShowID = 0)
	BEGIN
	    IF EXISTS (
	           SELECT Title
	           FROM   Show WHERE Title = @Title
	       )
	    BEGIN
	        SELECT -2
	    END
	    ELSE
	    BEGIN
	        SELECT 0
	    END
	END
	ELSE
	BEGIN
	    IF EXISTS (
	           SELECT Title
	           FROM   Show
	           WHERE Title = @Title AND  PKShowID <> @ShowID
	       )
	    BEGIN
	        SELECT -2
	    END
	    ELSE
	    BEGIN
	        SELECT 0
	    END
	END
END


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CheckUsername]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CheckUsername] (  
 @UserName varchar(150)
)  
AS  
begin  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
if exists (select null from Technician where UserName = @UserName)  
begin  
select -1  
end  
else  
begin  
select 0  
end  
end


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CheckUsernameAndEmail]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CheckUsernameAndEmail] (  
 @UserName varchar(150),  
 @Email varchar(150)  
)  
AS  
begin  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
if exists (select null from Technician where UserName = @UserName)  
begin  
select -1  
end  
else if exists (select null from Technician where Email = @Email)  
begin  
select -2  
end  
else  
begin  
select 0  
end  
end  
  
GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CheckUsernameAndEmailForUpdate]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
Create PROCEDURE [dbo].[CheckUsernameAndEmailForUpdate] (  
 @UserName varchar(150),  
 @Email varchar(150) ,
 @PKTechnicianID int  
)  
AS  
begin  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
if exists (select null from Technician where UserName = @UserName and PKTechnicianID != @PKTechnicianID)  
begin  
select -1  
end  
else if exists (select null from Technician where Email = @Email and PKTechnicianID != @PKTechnicianID)  
begin  
select -2  
end  
else  
begin  
select 0  
end  
end  
  
GO

/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerDelete]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerDelete] (  
 @PKCustomerID int  
)  
AS  
  
SET NOCOUNT ON  

if not exists(select PKShowID from show where FKCustomerID =   @PKCustomerID)
BEGIN
	delete from CustomerShowRating where FKCustomerID = @PKCustomerID
	DELETE FROM  
	 [Customer]  
	WHERE  
	 [PKCustomerID] = @PKCustomerID  
	 
	 SELECT 1 as returnval
END
ELSE
BEGIN

		 Declare @StateMent nvarchar(max) 
         select @StateMent = '';
         with shows as
         (select s.PKShowID as ShowID from Show s where s.FKCustomerID = @PKCustomerID )
			select @StateMent = @StateMent + 'EXEC ShowDelete ' + cast(ShowID as varchar) +';' from shows
			EXEC sp_executesql @StateMent
			delete from CustomerShowRating where FKCustomerID = @PKCustomerID
			--select * from CustomerShowRating 
			DELETE FROM [Customer] WHERE [PKCustomerID] = @PKCustomerID 	        
	        SELECT 1 as returnval

	--SELECT -1 as returnval
END	 

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerInsert]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
    
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerInsert] (    
 @CustomerName varchar(50),    
 @Address varchar(450),    
 @City varchar(50),    
 @State varchar(50),    
 @ZipCode varchar(50),    
 @Country varchar(50),    
 @Phone1 varchar(15),    
 @Phone2 varchar(15),    
 @Fax varchar(15),    
 @Mobile varchar(15),    
 @Email varchar(150)    
)    
AS    
begin  
SET NOCOUNT ON    
IF EXISTS (    
        SELECT NULL    
        FROM   Customer    
        WHERE  CustomerName = @CustomerName  
    )    
 BEGIN    
     SELECT -1    
 END  
 else if exists (Select null from Customer where [Email] = @Email)    
begin    
select -2    
end
      
 ELSE    
 BEGIN   
    
INSERT INTO [Customer] (    
 [CustomerName],    
 [Address],    
 [City],    
 [State],    
 [ZipCode],    
 [Country],    
 [Phone1],    
 [Phone2],    
 [Fax],    
 [Mobile],    
 [Email]    
) VALUES (    
 @CustomerName,    
 @Address,    
 @City,    
 @State,    
 @ZipCode,    
 @Country,    
 @Phone1,    
 @Phone2,    
 @Fax,    
 @Mobile,    
 @Email    
)    
    
SELECT SCOPE_IDENTITY() AS PKCustomerID    
end  
end

GO

	@PKCustomerID int

	[PKCustomerID],
	[CustomerName],
	[Address],
	[City],
	[State],
	[ZipCode],
	[Country],
	[Phone1],
	[Phone2],
	[Fax],
	[Mobile],
	[Email]
FROM
	[Customer]
WHERE
	[PKCustomerID] = @PKCustomerID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerSelectAll]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO


CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerSelectAll] (
    @PageIndex          INT,
    @RecordsPerPage     INT,
    @SortBy             NVARCHAR(50),
    @OrderBy            NVARCHAR(50),
    @SearchText         NVARCHAR(50)
)
AS
	SET NOCOUNT ON    
	DECLARE @startRowIndex INT;    
	DECLARE @endRowIndex INT;    
	DECLARE @Str NVARCHAR(MAX)    
	SET @endRowIndex = (@PageIndex * @RecordsPerPage);    
	SET @startRowIndex = (@endRowIndex - @RecordsPerPage) + 1;    
	
	SET @Str = 'select * from (    
 SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY ' + @SortBy + ' ' + @OrderBy + ') as Row,    
    [PKCustomerID], 
    [CustomerName],
	[Address],
	[City],
	[State],
	[ZipCode],
	[Country],
	[Phone1],
	[Phone2],
	[Fax],
	[Mobile],
	[Email]
    FROM [dbo].[Customer] where    
    CustomerName like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%'' or
    Email like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%'' or
    City like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%'' or 
	State like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%''
	) as tmpTable    
    WHERE Row between     
    @startRowIndex and @endRowIndex;' 
	    
	    PRINT(@STR)   
	
	    EXEC sp_executesql @STR,
	    N' @endRowIndex INT = NULL,    
        @startRowIndex INT = NULL,    
        @SortBy nvarchar(50)=null,    
        @OrderBy nvarchar(50)=null,    
        @SearchText nvarchar(50)=null',
	    @endRowIndex,
	    @startRowIndex,
	    @SortBy,
	    @OrderBy,
	    @SearchText;    
	
	SELECT COUNT(*)
	FROM   [dbo].Customer
	WHERE  CustomerName like '%' + @SearchText+'%' or
                  Email like '%' + @SearchText+'%' or
                  City like '%' + @SearchText+'%' or 
	              State like '%' + @SearchText+'%'
     


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerSelectAll_List]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerSelectAll_List]   
AS  
        
 SELECT       
   [PKCustomerID],     
 [CustomerName]   
      FROM [dbo].[Customer]   
      order by CustomerName

/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingInsert]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingInsert] (
	@FKShowID int,
	@RatingBy int,
	@IsHireAgain bit,
	@Description varchar(500),
	@Prompt float(53),
	@Professional float(53),
	@Experience float(53),
	@Attitude float(53),
	@OverAndAbove float(53),
	@AverageRate float(53)
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

INSERT INTO [CustomerShowRating] (
	[FKShowID],
	[RatingBy],
	[IsHireAgain],
	[Description],
	[Prompt],
	[Professional],
	[Experience],
	[Attitude],
	[OverAndAbove],
	[AverageRate]
) VALUES (
	@FKShowID,
	@RatingBy,
	@IsHireAgain,
	@Description,
	@Prompt,
	@Professional,
	@Experience,
	@Attitude,
	@OverAndAbove,
	(@Prompt + @Professional +@Experience + @Attitude + @OverAndAbove) / 5
)

SELECT SCOPE_IDENTITY() AS PKCustomerShowRatingID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingSelect]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingSelect] (
	@PKCustomerShowRatingID int
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

SELECT
	[PKCustomerShowRatingID],
	[FKShowID],
	[RatingBy],
	[IsHireAgain],
	[Description],
	[Prompt],
	[Professional],
	[Experience],
	[Attitude],
	[OverAndAbove],
	[AverageRate]
FROM
	[CustomerShowRating]
WHERE
	[PKCustomerShowRatingID] = @PKCustomerShowRatingID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingSelectByFKShowID]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingSelectByFKShowID] (
	@FKShowID int
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON
Select Title as ShowName from Show where PKShowID =  @FKShowID
SELECT
	[PKCustomerShowRatingID],
	[FKShowID],
	[RatingBy],
	[IsHireAgain],
	[Description],
	[Prompt],
	[Professional],
	[Experience],
	[Attitude],
	[OverAndAbove],
	[AverageRate]
FROM
	[CustomerShowRating]
WHERE
	[FKShowID] = @FKShowID

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingUpdate]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerShowRatingUpdate] (
	@PKCustomerShowRatingID int,
	@FKShowID int,
	@RatingBy int,
	@IsHireAgain bit,
	@Description varchar(500),
	@Prompt float(53),
	@Professional float(53),
	@Experience float(53),
	@Attitude float(53),
	@OverAndAbove float(53),
	@AverageRate float(53)
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

UPDATE
	[CustomerShowRating]
SET
	[FKShowID] = @FKShowID,
	[RatingBy] = @RatingBy,
	[IsHireAgain] = @IsHireAgain,
	[Description] = @Description,
	[Prompt] = @Prompt,
	[Professional] = @Professional,
	[Experience] = @Experience,
	[Attitude] = @Attitude,
	[OverAndAbove] = @OverAndAbove,
	[AverageRate] = (@Prompt + @Professional +@Experience + @Attitude + @OverAndAbove) / 5  
WHERE
	 [PKCustomerShowRatingID] = @PKCustomerShowRatingID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[CustomerUpdate]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
    
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[CustomerUpdate] (    
 @PKCustomerID int,    
 @CustomerName varchar(50),    
 @Address varchar(450),    
 @City varchar(50),    
 @State varchar(50),    
 @ZipCode varchar(50),    
 @Country varchar(50),    
 @Phone1 varchar(15),    
 @Phone2 varchar(15),    
 @Fax varchar(15),    
 @Mobile varchar(15),    
 @Email varchar(150)    
)    
AS    
    
SET NOCOUNT ON    
  
  if exists (select null from Customer where CustomerName= @CustomerName and PKCustomerID <> @PKCustomerID)      
begin      
select -2      
end 
else if exists (select null from Customer where Email=@Email and PKCustomerID <> @PKCustomerID)
begin 
select -1
end     
else      
begin      
      
UPDATE    
 [Customer]    
SET    
 [CustomerName] = @CustomerName,    
 [Address] = @Address,    
 [City] = @City,    
 [State] = @State,    
 [ZipCode] = @ZipCode,    
 [Country] = @Country,    
 [Phone1] = @Phone1,    
 [Phone2] = @Phone2,    
 [Fax] = @Fax,    
 [Mobile] = @Mobile,    
 [Email] = @Email    
WHERE    
  [PKCustomerID] = @PKCustomerID    
    
  select @PKCustomerID  
  end  

GO

SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO

GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionInsert] (
	@FKTechnicianID int,
	@FKAdminID int,
	@Subject nvarchar(255),
	@Message nvarchar(max),
	@IsRead bit,
	@DocumentPaths nvarchar(max),
	@AdminIDs nvarchar(max),
	@CreatedDate datetime
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

INSERT INTO [Discussion] (
	[FKTechnicianID],
	[FKAdminID],
	[Subject],
	[Message],
	[IsRead],
	[DocumentPaths],
	[AdminIDs],
	[CreatedDate],
	UpdatedDate
) VALUES (
	@FKTechnicianID,
	@FKAdminID,
	@Subject,
	@Message,
	@IsRead,
	@DocumentPaths,
	@AdminIDs,
	@CreatedDate,
	getdate()
)

SELECT SCOPE_IDENTITY() AS PKDiscussionID

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[DiscussionListing]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
---		Exec [DiscussionListing] 1,10,'','CreatedDate','desc',122

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionListing] 

(

	@PageIndex INT,

	@RecordsPerPage INT,

	@SearchText nvarchar(50),

	@SortBy nvarchar(50),

	@OrderBy nvarchar(50),

	@FKTechnicianID int

) AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

	Declare @startRowIndex INT;

	Declare @endRowIndex INT;

	declare @Str nvarchar(max)

	set @endRowIndex = (@PageIndex * @RecordsPerPage);

	set @startRowIndex = (@endRowIndex - @RecordsPerPage) + 1;



	

	set @Str =	'

	SELECT  tmpTable.* FROM (

	SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY '+@SortBy+' '+@OrderBy+') as Row,

	[PKDiscussionID],

	FKTechnicianID,

	(select FirstName from Account where PKAccountID = FKAdminID) as AdminName,

	[Subject],

	[Message],

	[IsRead],

	[DocumentPaths],

	[AdminIDs],

	
	CONVERT(VARCHAR(20), CreatedDate, 100) as CreatedDate

FROM

	[Discussion] where Subject like ''%'' + @SearchText+''%'' and FKTechnicianID = @FKTechnicianID) as tmpTable

	WHERE Row between 

	@startRowIndex and @endRowIndex;'



	print(@STR)

	

	

	-- Table 1: Content record

	EXEC sp_executesql @STR, N'	@endRowIndex INT = NULL,

								@startRowIndex INT = NULL,

								@SortBy nvarchar(50)=null,

								@OrderBy nvarchar(50)=null,

								@SearchText nvarchar(50)=null,

								@FKTechnicianID int = null',

								@endRowIndex,

								@startRowIndex,

								@SortBy,

								@OrderBy,

								@SearchText,

								@FKTechnicianID;





  select count(*)as TotalRecords from [Discussion] where [Subject] like '%' + @SearchText + '%' and FKTechnicianID = @FKTechnicianID



  Select FirstName, LastName, Email from Technician where PKTechnicianID = @FKTechnicianID

GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionPostInsert] (
	@FKDiscussionID int,
	@Message nvarchar(max),
	@IsRead bit,
	@DocumentPaths nvarchar(max),
	@AdminIDs nvarchar(max),
	@CreatedDate datetime,
	@FKAdminID int
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

INSERT INTO [DiscussionPost] (
	[FKDiscussionID],
	[Message],
	[IsRead],
	[DocumentPaths],
	[AdminIDs],
	[CreatedDate],
	[FKAdminID ]
) VALUES (
	@FKDiscussionID,
	@Message,
	@IsRead,
	@DocumentPaths,
	@AdminIDs,
	@CreatedDate,
	@FKAdminID 
)

SELECT SCOPE_IDENTITY() AS PKDiscussionPostID

GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionPostSelectByFKDiscussionID] (

	@FKDiscussionID int

)

AS



SET NOCOUNT ON



SELECT

	[PKDiscussionPostID],

	[FKDiscussionID],

	[Message],

	[IsRead],

	[DocumentPaths],

	[AdminIDs],
	(select FirstName + dbo.RemoveLastDashChars(LastName) from Account where PKAccountID =  FKAdminID) as Name,

	[CreatedDate]

FROM

	[DiscussionPost]

WHERE

	[FKDiscussionID] = @FKDiscussionID

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionPostUpdate] (
	@PKDiscussionPostID int,
	@FKDiscussionID int,
	@Message nvarchar(max),
	@IsRead bit,
	@DocumentPaths nvarchar(max),
	@AdminIDs nvarchar(max),
	@CreatedDate datetime,
	@FKAdminID int 
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

UPDATE
	[DiscussionPost]
SET
	[FKDiscussionID] = @FKDiscussionID,
	[Message] = @Message,
	[IsRead] = @IsRead,
	[DocumentPaths] = @DocumentPaths,
	[AdminIDs] = @AdminIDs,
	FKAdminID = @FKAdminID
	--[CreatedDate] = @CreatedDate
WHERE
	 [PKDiscussionPostID] = @PKDiscussionPostID

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[DiscussionSelect]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
--- exec [DiscussionSelect] 8
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionSelect] (
	@PKDiscussionID int
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

SELECT
	[PKDiscussionID],
	[FKTechnicianID],
	[FKAdminID],
	[Subject],
	[Message],
	[IsRead],
	[DocumentPaths],
	[AdminIDs],
	[CreatedDate]
FROM
	[Discussion]
WHERE
	[PKDiscussionID] = @PKDiscussionID

	SELECT TOP 1000 [PKDiscussionPostID]
      ,[FKDiscussionID]
      ,[Message]
      ,[IsRead]
      ,[DocumentPaths]
      ,[AdminIDs]
      ,[CreatedDate]
	  ,FKAdminID
	  ,(select FirstName + dbo.RemoveLastDashChars(LastName) from Account where PKAccountID =  FKAdminID) as Name
  FROM [DiscussionPost] where [FKDiscussionID]   =  @PKDiscussionID


 




GO

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[DiscussionUpdate] (
	@PKDiscussionID int,
	@FKTechnicianID int,
	@FKAdminID int,
	@Subject nvarchar(255),
	@Message nvarchar(max),
	@IsRead bit,
	@DocumentPaths nvarchar(max),
	@AdminIDs nvarchar(max),
	@CreatedDate datetime
)
AS

SET NOCOUNT ON

UPDATE
	[Discussion]
SET
	[FKTechnicianID] = @FKTechnicianID,
	[FKAdminID] = @FKAdminID,
	[Subject] = @Subject,
	[Message] = @Message,
	[IsRead] = @IsRead,
	[DocumentPaths] = @DocumentPaths,
	[AdminIDs] = @AdminIDs,
	--[CreatedDate] = @CreatedDate,
	UpdatedDate = getdate()

WHERE
	 [PKDiscussionID] = @PKDiscussionID

GO

SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO


CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[EmailTemplateUpdate] (

	@PKEmailSettingID int,

	@SelectedToGroups nvarchar(MAX),

	@ToEmail nvarchar(MAX),

	@CCEmail nvarchar(MAX),

	@Subject nvarchar(MAX),

	@Body nvarchar(MAX),

	@EmailFrom nvarchar(255),

	@Title nvarchar(255),

	@Name nvarchar(255),
	@IsOn bit

)

AS



SET NOCOUNT ON



UPDATE

	[EmailTemplate]

SET

	[SelectedToGroups] = @SelectedToGroups,

	[ToEmail] = @ToEmail,

	[CCEmail] = @CCEmail,

	[Subject] = @Subject,

	[Body] = @Body,

	[EmailFrom] = @EmailFrom,

	[Title] = @Title,
	isOn=@isOn
	--[Name] = @Name

WHERE

	 [PKEmailSettingID] = @PKEmailSettingID

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[GetBidApprovedData]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
/************************************************************

 * Code formatted by SoftTree SQL Assistant © v4.5.9

 * Time: 12/14/2012 3:27:18 PM

 ************************************************************/

--- EXEC GetBidApprovedData 36,117,13

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[GetBidApprovedData](@ShowID INT, @TechnicianID INT, @PositionID INT)

AS

BEGIN

		SELECT 1,

		(SELECT t.Email 

		   FROM Technician t WHERE t.PKTechnicianID = @TechnicianID) AS Email,

		(SELECT t.Firstname  FROM Technician t WHERE t.PKTechnicianID = @TechnicianID) AS TechnicianName,

		(SELECT Title  FROM Show s WHERE s.PKShowID = @ShowID) AS ShowName,

		(SELECT PositionName FROM Position p WHERE p.PKPositionID = @PositionID) AS PositionName,
		(select BidAmount from bid b  where FKShowID=@ShowID and FKShowPositionID=@PositionID and FKTechnicianID=@TechnicianID) as BidRate,
		(select PKBidID from bid b  where FKShowID=@ShowID and FKShowPositionID=@PositionID and FKTechnicianID=@TechnicianID) as PKBidID
	

END

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[GetConfirmedTechsByShow]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
-- exec [GetConfirmedTechsByShow] 38

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[GetConfirmedTechsByShow](@ShowID INT)  
AS 
BEGIN 
 SELECT t.[PKTechnicianID],
        t.[Firstname] ,  
		t.[Lastname] ,  
		t.Email,	
		b.PKBidID,
        ISNULL((SELECT AVG(b.BidAmount) FROM bid b WHERE  b.fktechnicianID = t.PKTechnicianID ),0) AS AvgBid, 
        ISNULL(b.BidAmount, 0) AS BidRate,
		case when(ISNULL(t.[Country],'') = '')    
        then    
        t.[City]     
        else    
        t.[City] + ', '+ t.[Country]    
        end as Location,
		ISNULL((SELECT RANK FROM (select row_number() over (order by isnull(tt.Rating,0) desc, tt.CreatedDate) as RANK,tt.PKTechnicianID
		FROM Technician tt WHERE tt.isApproved = 1 ) AS tmp WHERE tmp.PKTechnicianID = t.PKTechnicianID),0) AS Rank,
        cast(t.[Rating] as decimal(10,2)) as [Rating],
        (SELECT TOP 1 p.PositionName FROM   Position p WHERE  p.pkPositionID = b.FKShowPositionID) AS Position, 
		(SELECT TOP 1 p.pkPositionID FROM   Position p WHERE  p.pkPositionID = b.FKShowPositionID) AS pkPositionid,
        ISNULL(b.isApproved, 0) AS Confirm,
        b.FKShowPositionID,  
        ISNULL(b.IsSuggested,0) AS Suggest
 FROM   dbo.Technician t INNER JOIN Bid b ON  t.PKTechnicianID = b.FKTechnicianID WHERE  b.FKShowID = @ShowID 
END  





GO

SET ANSI_NULLS ON

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[GetEmails]
AS
	
	
	SELECT s.PKSettingID,
		   s.Email1,
		   s.Email2,
		   s.Email3,
		   s.Daily,
		   s.MonWedFriday,
		   s.Weekly 
	FROM Settings s
	

GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[GetNewTechTrackApplications]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE procedure [dbo].[GetNewTechTrackApplications]
as
begin
declare @LastEmailSentDate datetime
set @LastEmailSentDate  = (Select top 1 LastEmailSentDate from Settings)
if(@LastEmailSentDate is null or @LastEmailSentDate = '')
begin
set @LastEmailSentDate = DATEADD(d,-7,getdate()) 
end
select PKTechnicianID,FirstName, LastName,City, isnull( (SELECT  STUFF((        
 select ', '+ CAST(p.PositionName as varchar) from Technician t       
 inner join TechnicianPositions tp ON t.PKTechnicianID=tp.FKTechnicianID inner join Position p      
 on p.PKPositionID=tp.FKPositionID  where tp.FKTechnicianID = dbo.Technician.PKTechnicianID  and StatusID = 1 order by PositionName    
 FOR XML PATH('')),1,1,'')) ,'')as Positions from Technician where CreatedDate > @LastEmailSentDate and IsApproved = 0
 update Settings set LastEmailSentDate = getdate()
end
GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[GetRecords]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
--exec [GetRecords] 2,2

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[GetRecords] 
	@PageIndex INT,
	@RecordsPerPage INT
AS  
BEGIN  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
	Declare @startRowIndex INT;
	Declare @endRowIndex INT;
	Declare @TotalRecords INT;
	set @endRowIndex = (@PageIndex * @RecordsPerPage);
	set @startRowIndex = (@endRowIndex - @RecordsPerPage) + 1;
	
	With RecordEntries as (
		SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY [PKTechnicianID] ASC) as Row,[PKTechnicianID]
      ,[Firstname]
      ,[LastName]
      ,[Address]
      ,[City]
      ,[State]
      ,[ZipCode]
      ,COUNT(*) OVER () AS Total
      FROM [dbo].[Technician]
	)
	Select [PKTechnicianID]
	  ,Total
      ,[Firstname]
      ,[LastName]
      ,[Address]
      ,[City]
      ,[State]
      ,[ZipCode] 
	FROM RecordEntries
	WHERE Row between 
	@startRowIndex and @endRowIndex
	
	SELECT COUNT(*) FROM [dbo].[Technician]
END


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[GetSelectedPositionName]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
-- =============================================
-- Author:		<Author,,Name>
-- Create date: <Create Date,,>
-- Description:	<Description,,>
-- =============================================

-- exec GetSelectedPositionName '2,'
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[GetSelectedPositionName]
	@PositionID VARCHAR(100)
AS
BEGIN


	-- SET NOCOUNT ON added to prevent extra result sets from
	-- interfering with SELECT statements.
	SET NOCOUNT ON;

    -- Insert statements for procedure here
	SELECT PositionName,PKPositionID FROM Position ps inner join dbo.ufn_CSVToTable(@PositionID,',') positionid on ps.PKPositionID=positionid.String

	
	
END

GO

---			Exec GetShowPublishData

CREATE Procedure [dbo].[GetShowPublishData]
as
begin
Select Distinct City from Technician where isnull(City,'') <> ''
Select PKTechnicianID, FirstName + dbo.RemoveLastDashChars(LastName) as Name from Technician where IsApproved = 1

end

/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[getWAHExceedTechs]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
---		exec getWAHExceedTechs

CREATE Procedure [dbo].[getWAHExceedTechs]
as
begin
DECLARE @CurrentDate DATETIME  
  
 SET @CurrentDate = GETDATE()    
  
 DECLARE @PreviousSDate DATETIME,@PreviousEDate DATETIME  
  
 SET @PreviousSDate = cast(cast(DATEADD(dd, -(DATEPART(dw, @CurrentDate-1)), @CurrentDate +1)  as varchar(12)) as datetime) 
 SET @PreviousEDate = cast(cast(DATEADD(dd, 7-(DATEPART(dw, @CurrentDate-1)), @CurrentDate )  as varchar(12)) as datetime) 



select convert(decimal(3,2),WeekLyavg) as WeekLyavg , Name,[WeeklyHours], [EmailAddress], FKTechnicianID as TechnicianID from(
select avg(t.TotalHours) as WeekLyAvg , ts.[WeeklyHours],ts.[EmailAddress],t.FKTechnicianID,
(select FirstName + ' ' +LastName as Name from Technician where PKTechnicianID = t.FKTechnicianID) as Name 
from TimeEntry t inner join [TechShowSettings] ts on t.FKTechnicianID = ts.[FKTechnicianID] 
where cast(cast(t.TaskDate as varchar(12)) as datetime) between @PreviousSDate
and @PreviousEDate and ts.[ToNotify] = 1 and isnull(ts.[EmailAddress] ,'') <> ''
 group by t.FKTechnicianID , ts.[WeeklyHours],ts.[EmailAddress],t.FKTechnicianID) as temp where WeekLyAvg >= [WeeklyHours]
 


end




GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[Login]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[Login] (  
 @UserName varchar(100),  
 @Password nvarchar(100)  
)  
AS  
  
SET NOCOUNT ON  
  
SELECT  
 a.[PKAccountID],  
 a.[FirstName],  
 a.[LastName],  
 a.[UserName],  
 a.[Password],  
 a.[Email],  
 a.[Position],  
 a.[ProfileImagePath],  
 a.[IsActive],  
 a.FKLevelID,  

 l.[Description] as [Level],  
 l.[LevelName] as [LevelName]  
   
FROM  
 Account a left join dbo.[Level] l on a.FKLevelID = l.PKLevelID  
WHERE  
 a.[UserName] = @UserName and a.[Password] = @Password  
   
   
--select FKLevelID from AccountLevel where FKAccountID = @PKAccountID


GO
/****** Object:  StoredProcedure [dbo].[MessageDelete]    Script Date: 07-03-2013 13:19:15 ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
